longBusinessSummary: Sato Holdings Corporation develops, manufactures, and sells data collection systems and labeling products in Japan and internationally. It operates through Auto-ID Solutions (Japan), Auto-ID Solutions (Overseas), and IDP segments. The company offers mechatronics products, including printers, scanners, automatic labelers, and hand labelers; and consumable products, such as printer labels, radio frequency identification tags, primary labels, and ribbons. It also provides auto-ID solutions for the combined use of products, including printers, labels, and software and maintenance services; CLNX series, a universal printer; and a cloud-based monitoring services for printers that enable preventive maintenance and on-the-spot troubleshooting. In addition, the company offers application enabled printing, which enables PC-less printing, as well as supports communication with host database or IT systems; variable information labels; inline digital printing; and application programming interface, a set of programming instruction and standards. Further, it provides software products, such as Windows printer drivers to support various printer models; NiceLabel, a barcode label design and print productivity solutions; BarTender software; All-In-One Tool, a printer management utility that allows users to configure SATO products across their system-wide infrastructure; WS4 and WS2 printer utilities; AEP, a platform for smart printing; and SAP solutions, an enterprise resource planning software. Additionally, the company provides RFID Device Service Provider software for instantiating, communicating, and managing printers; XML Printing solutions; SmaPri for Android, a label printing solution for Android OS platform; SATO CUPS Driver for Linux and Mac OS X; SATO Printer API to simplify the communication between .NET applications and SATO printers; and maintenance support services. The company was founded in 1940 and is headquartered in Tokyo, Japan.
